page.title: 17A fire at Perse School
page.content: FRIDAY JULY 5th 1985 Mystery blaze at the Perse School for Girls,Union Road,Cambridge. The fire broke out at approximately 4am this morning causing extensive damage. Two laboratories were gutted and the rest of the building was severely smoke damaged. Firemen were called from the surrounding areas to help fight the massive fire. Tiles had to be taken off the roof to let the smoke escape. Altogether seven fire- engines and thirty firemen were in attendance to bring the fire under control. No-one was in the building at the time and police searching for the cause of the fire would like to hear from anyone who saw anything suspicious near the school last night. The school is closed today but the headmistress,Miss Bateman,said lessons would continue normally next week.
